A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.<RF>upon…: or, according to variable songs, or, tunes, called in Hebrew, Shigionoth<Rf>

O LORD, I have heard thy speech, <FI>and<Fi> was afraid: O LORD, revive thy work in the midst of the years, in the midst of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.<RF>speech: Heb. report, or, hearing<Rf><RF>revive: or, preserve alive<Rf><CM>
God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.<RF>Teman: or, the south<Rf>
And <FI>his<Fi> brightness was as the light; he had horns <FI>coming<Fi> out of his hand: and there <FI>was<Fi> the hiding of his power.<RF>horns…: or, bright beams out of his side<Rf>
Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth at his feet.<RF>coals: or, diseases<Rf>
He stood, and measured the earth: he beheld, and drove asunder the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered, the perpetual hills did bow: his ways <FI>are<Fi> everlasting.
I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: <FI>and<Fi> the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.<RF>Cushan: or, Ethiopia<Rf><RF>in…: or, under affliction, or, vanity<Rf>

Was the LORD displeased against the rivers? <FI>was<Fi> thine anger against the rivers? <FI>was<Fi> thy wrath against the sea, that thou didst ride upon thine horses <FI>and<Fi> thy chariots of salvation?<RF>of…: or, were salvation?<Rf>
Thy bow was made quite naked, <FI>according<Fi> to the oaths of the tribes, <FI>even thy<Fi> word. Selah. Thou didst cleave the earth with rivers.<RF>earth…: or, rivers of the earth<Rf>
The mountains saw thee, <FI>and<Fi> they trembled: the overflowing of the water passed by: the deep uttered his voice, <FI>and<Fi> lifted up his hands on high.

The sun <FI>and<Fi> moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of thine arrows they went, <FI>and<Fi> at the shining of thy glittering spear.<RF>at the light…: or, thine arrows walked in the light<Rf>
Thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst thresh the heathen in anger.

Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, <FI>even<Fi> for salvation with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked, by discovering the foundation unto the neck. Selah.<RF>by…: Heb. making naked<Rf>

Thou didst strike through with his staves the head of his villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing <FI>was<Fi> as to devour the poor secretly.<RF>came…: Heb. were tempestuous<Rf>
Thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses, <FI>through<Fi> the heap of great waters.<RF>heap: or, mud<Rf><CM>

When I heard, my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice: rottenness entered into my bones, and I trembled in myself, that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the people, he will invade them with his troops.<RF>invade…: or, cut them in pieces<Rf>

Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither <FI>shall<Fi> fruit <FI>be<Fi> in the vines; the labour of the olive shall fail, and the fields shall yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and <FI>there shall be<Fi> no herd in the stalls:<RF>fail: Heb. lie<Rf>
Yet I will rejoice in the LORD, I will joy in the God of my salvation.

The LORD God <FI>is<Fi> my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds' <FI>feet<Fi>, and he will make me to walk upon mine high places. To the chief singer on my stringed instruments.<RF>stringed…: Heb. Neginoth<Rf><CM>
